面.definition: face; side; surface; aspect; top; classifier for objects with flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

面世.definition: to be published (of art, literary works etc); to come out; to take shape; to see the light of day

面交.definition: to deliver personally; to hand over face-to-face

面前.definition: in front of; facing; (in the) presence (of)

面友.definition: to put on a friendly face

面嚮.definition: to face; to turn towards; to incline to; geared towards; catering for; -oriented; facial feature; appearance; aspect; facet

面嚮對象語言.pinyin: miàn xiàng duì xiàng yǔ yán

面基.definition: (slang) (of online friends) to meet up in person

面壁.definition: to face the wall; to sit facing the wall in meditation (Buddhism); (fig.) to devote oneself to study, work etc

面壁思過.definition: to face the wall and ponder about one's misdeeds; to stand in the corner (punishment); (fig.) to examine one's conscience

面子.definition: outer surface; the outside of sth; social prestige; face

面巾.definition: face flannel or towel; shroud (over the face of a corpse)

面市.definition: to hit the market (of a new product)

面帶愁容.definition: with a sad air; looking melancholy; with a worried look

面影.definition: face (esp. remembered); mental image of sb

面心立方最密堆積.pinyin: miàn xīn lì fāng zuì mì duī jī

面惡心善.definition: to have a mean-looking face but a heart of gold (idiom)

面授.definition: to teach face to face; to instruct in person

面授機宜.definition: (idiom) to brief sb in person on the line of action to pursue; to advise face-to-face on how to deal with the present situation

面料.definition: material for making clothes; CL:塊|块[kuai4]

面斥.definition: to reproach sb to his face

面有難色.definition: to show signs of reluctance or embarrassment

面朝黃土背朝天.pinyin: miàn cháo huáng tǔ bèi cháo tiān
面朝黃土背朝天.definition: face to the ground, back to the sky

面皮.definition: cheek; face; leather covering (for handbags etc)

面目一新.definition: complete change (idiom); facelift; We're in a wholly new situation.

面目全非.definition: nothing remains the same (idiom); change beyond recognition

面稱.definition: term used to directly address a person (contrasted with 背稱|背称[bei4 cheng1]); to praise sb in their presence

面積.definition: area (of a floor, piece of land etc); surface area; tract of land

面罩.definition: mask; visor; facepiece (e.g. diving suit, gas mask)

面聖.definition: (old) to have an audience with the emperor

面膜.definition: facial mask; cleanser; face pack; facial (treatment)

面臨.definition: to face sth; to be confronted with

面見.definition: to meet face to face; to meet in person

面試.definition: to be interviewed (as a candidate); interview

面諛.definition: to praise sb to his face

面謝.definition: to thank sb personally; to thank sb to his face

面議.definition: to bargain face-to-face; to negotiate directly

面譽.definition: to praise sb in his presence

面貌.definition: face; features; appearance; look; CL:個|个[ge4]

面露.definition: to look (tired, pleased etc); to wear (a smile, a puzzled expression etc)

面面俱到.definition: (idiom) take care of everything; handle everything

面面相覷.definition: to look at each other in dismay (idiom)

面黃肌瘦.definition: lit. face yellow and body emaciated (idiom); fig. malnourished and sickly in appearance
